content.description: Enjoy some big pockets up to the horizontal crack. Trust some less positive pockets on the arete near the top.
content.location: Up the right side of the nose of Dip Boulder, opposite Juggs Haul. Use both sides of the arete up top. Same start as Logan's Climb.

content.description: Future area classic, a true working man's boulder problem.   Start with your choice of either wide crack, or overhung tips crack (possibly harder than V0). Lieback your way up a couple of moves to buckets. Gain the keyhole. Rest up on a ledge large enough to bivy on and resist the temptation to escape onto the face to the left. Shuffle right until a gap wide enough for a well proportioned human appears above. Chimney up and out, crux is hip movement to leave the slot.
content.protection: Pads for the bottom, wide butt for the top.
content.location: Directly right of the scooped face of the Dip Boulder. Hard to miss.

content.description: Fall left into the mouth feature. Use technical feet to stay off the boulder to the left and ascend up shallow pockets on the face. Top out is not for the faint of heart.
content.protection: 3 pads on ground, one on side boulder. Don't fall at the top. Seriously.
content.location: Sit or stand start the nose of Dip Boulder where Juggs Haul begins. Go left immediately. Avoid the scary boulder to the left with hands and feet (and also while falling).

content.description: Start on the chest height jugs on the arete. Follow the crack feature up the left face, using good holds. Transition on to the right face and traverse right on the good lip, then top out to the left of the fallen tree. Top out is dirty/chossy.

Start low on a pretty nice start jug, work your way up the arete and stick the jug. Go left hand to the pinch above that and dead point or reach high to the obvious jug rail. Traverse the jug rail till you get to the end, then mantle or stem your way up to a chossy finish.
content.location: About 50 feet to the left of the Bay Wall.

content.description: Start low on the arete. Use jug holds and crack feature, head straight up to upper face. Pull over bulge on interesting holds. Crux is high
content.protection: Its tall, use a few pads
content.location: Arete left of scooped face on Dip Boulder

content.description: Navigate the blank face up to the bomber rail. Gain the top by finding the more reasonable honeycomb shaped features above the rail.
content.protection: 3 pads + spotter. Avoid the boulder back right.
content.location: Start straight up the bowl shaped face between Logan's/Patrick's climbs and Slim Jim.

content.description: A reasonably tall boulder with a chossy finish. Decent landing area as long as you avoid the tree or rock to the right. Cool features make for lots of interesting and different ways to the top.
